title: Random Unplayable Lag for no Apparent Reason (Loss of character control)
body:
This doesn't happen every game I play, but it's been happening way more frequently lately.
It seems to only happen at Night/Really early, but I'm saying that based off of previous experience, for all I know it could be permanent now.

Basically, I'll be in game. Everything for the most part is normal, I have normal Ping (36) and I'm not sure if my FPS drops during it or not, I don't know my normal FPS because I've had the counter turned off for awhile unnoticed. I don't have constant lag, but every 20 or so seconds, sometimes sooner, I get this random spike where my ping shoots up, only about 10ms mind you, to around 45-50ms, which isn't bad, but for some reason, it makes it impossible to play the game. I completely lose control of my character for a good 6-7 seconds, sometimes longer, but the rest of the game goes on without me, and I can see everything that's happening, I just lost complete control of my character. Then, everything goes back to normal, and then it happens again in another 20 or so seconds. The game is unbearably annoying, unplayable and i can't stand it. I'm pretty sure it's not my internet, but I could be wrong. I say that based on the fact that 99% of the time my games are completely normal. 

Does anybody know what the problem is or a fix?
Is it my computer, my internet, riot servers or what?

replies.body:
This sounds like pretty common symptoms of *Packet Loss*, which happens if the packets of data sent or received from the servers is lost along the way. I'd recommend ensuring your local network settings are compatible with League by working through our [connection guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

Let me know if this caused any change.

I would also like to point out that this "lag" doesn't happen 99% of the time, for that 99% I have the perfect experience. A couple of days ago when I posted this, I had this "lag" and it was extremely frustrating. It would just start to happen one game, and it wouldn't stop, long stretches of me not being able to control my character, cast spells, or even ping or talk in chat. This freeze could last for ~10 or more seconds sometimes, meanwhile I can see everyone else do everything in real time. After i woke up the next day, I had one of those, "Updates" where it says it's patching, but it doesn't look like it's doing anything, and it never gets to 100%, it just stays at 0% and then disappears. I don't know if that has anything to do with it, but afterwards my game worked fine. I also notice I tend to only notice it some days, but the days I do get it, it usually happens at night. I've been playing for the past 3 or 4 days, day and night, and I haven't had any of this "Lag." But today, back at it again, where I'm just playing and one game it randomly starts up.

I did the packet loss test thing, but I don't know what any of it means, however, here's the "Noteworthy: Minor aberrations"


Minor Aberrations
â€“

    Certain TCP protocols are blocked in outbound traffic
    We detected at least one proxy
    The network indicated bursts of packet loss
    Network packet buffering may be excessive
    We received unexpected and possibly dangerous results when looking up important names
    Certain TCP protocols are blocked in outbound traffic
    Only some root servers returned DNSSEC information 

I see that it says the bursts of packet loss, does that mean it's my ISP? And if so, that basically means there's nothing I can do about it, I just have to deal with it sometimes?

Packet loss just means there's an issue between your PC and the server. This could be caused by something local on your network or along your network routing to our servers. Have you encountered any further instances of these symptoms since going through the steps in the connection guide?

I haven't had any in a while, but this morning I was playing my final promo game, first game of the day and the lag was back. I'm going to take a break for a few hours and see if it resolves it self again like it always does, it's just annoying that the lag is seemingly random and I don't know when it is going to happen. I hasn't happened since I posted that last comment either, just now again. It just randomly fixes itself and randomly shows up again.

Is this happening during peak hours (5PM-10PM)? I'd like you to run some traceroutes using the WinMTR instructions at the bottom of [this step](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2).

Let me know if you run into troubles running through those steps.

Okay, so I ran the traceroute, and got the .txt file. Not sure what it means, but I posted it as a ticket on the support boards. And as for whether or not it happens at peak times, as I said before it happens at seemingly random. Yesterday at roughly 1am I was getting the lag, and today at around 4pm I was experiencing it. Another side question, could it also be my PC? It's been awhile since I've cleaned it out, but I'm not sure if that would cause what's happening to me in game to happen or not. It's happening more frequently however, I'm having the same problem as before, it just seems to happen more sporatically in game. I'll start the game with 200~ FPS, but once I see it fall to the low 100s~ I know that's when I'm going to start losing control.

We've already ruled out local network settings, so it's very likely something along your network routing. I forgot to mention you can simply reply to me with your traceroute results, it's not necessary to wait on a support ticket.

Oh. :)


Tracing route to 192.64.170.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1     1 ms     1 ms     1 ms  10.0.0.1 
  2    14 ms    12 ms    16 ms  96.120.11.121 
  3    14 ms    12 ms    10 ms  xe-9-0-0-sur01.dover.de.bad.comcast.net [68.86.255.129] 
  4    92 ms    16 ms    17 ms  ae-64-0-ar01.whitemarsh.md.bad.comcast.net [68.87.136.97] 
  5    20 ms    24 ms    19 ms  be-33657-cr02.newyork.ny.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.94.101] 
  6    20 ms    19 ms    18 ms  be-33-pe01.60hudson.ny.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.84.78] 
  7    25 ms    22 ms    18 ms  50.248.116.202 
  8    19 ms    24 ms    18 ms  104.160.132.44 
  9    37 ms    36 ms    33 ms  ae31-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.14] 
 10    33 ms    34 ms    34 ms  104.160.131.101 
 11    35 ms    36 ms    36 ms  192.64.170.1 

Trace complete.

I usually get 36 ping if that helps
Also would it help if I recorded a video of it happening and uploaded it to youtube and linked it here? Just for a better representation of exactly what's happening?

A video may be helpful, but I think a more detailed traceroute using [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) may be just what we need. Be sure to run the trace during a time you're experiencing the symptoms of your issue. After opening the WinMTR App, simply plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export the results as text and paste them in a reply.

Thanks!

Ok, I will do that. Unfortunately (Or not-Unfortunately) I don't have the lag at this moment, or so it seems. But I'm sure it'll resurface soon, so when it does I'll get back to this and I'll do the traceroute.
i have same problem i did ping and speed test for my internet and it was ok, i have lag just when i enter a game -_- from patch 6.22 none could help me :/
